intro: Hieracium stenomacrum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are narrow and usually have a hairy texture, while its flowers are yellow with ray florets. Hieracium stenomacrum is often found in temperate regions and can spread through rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in some areas.
